郭台銘.definition: Guo "Terry" Taiming (1950-), prominent Taiwanese businessman, founder of Foxconn

郭子儀.definition: Guo Ziyi (697-781), Tang dynasty general who helped suppress the An Lushan Rebellion and served multiple emperors

郭小川.definition: Guo Xiaochuan (1919-1976), PRC communist poet, hero in the war with Japan, died after long persecution during Cultural Revolution

郭居靜.definition: Lazzaro Cattaneo (1560-1640), Italian Jesuit missionary in China

郭嵩燾.definition: Guo Songtao (1818-1891), Chinese statesman and diplomat, served as minister to Britain and minister to France 1877-1879

郭敬明.definition: Guo Jingming (1983-), Chinese young-adult fiction writer and teen pop idol

郭晶晶.definition: Guo Jingjing (1981-), Chinese female diver and Olympic gold medalist

郭沫若.definition: Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik

郭泉.definition: Guo Quan, formerly Professor of Nanjing Normal University, sacked after founding New People's Party of China 中國新民黨|中国新民党

郭茂倩.definition: Guo Maoqian (11th century), Song dynasty editor of the Collection of Yuefu Songs and Ballads 樂府詩集|乐府诗集[Yue4 fu3 Shi1 ji2]
